title: JWT Authentication Success
description: Verify that users can successfully authenticate using valid credentials and receive a JWT token with correct role assignments.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Enter valid username and password for Staff role.
Submit login request.
Verify JWT token is issued and stored securely.
Verify user is redirected to Staff home page with proper permissions.

title: JWT Authentication Failure with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify the system rejects authentication attempts with incorrect username or password and provides appropriate error messages.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Enter invalid username and/or password.
Submit login request.
Verify login is rejected and error message is shown.
Verify no JWT token is issued or stored.

title: Role-based Access Control Enforcement
description: Verify users with different roles (Staff, Supervisor, Admin) can only access authorized modules and perform permitted actions.

steps.description: Login as Staff and attempt to access Admin control panel.
Verify access is denied with appropriate notification.
Login as Supervisor and access supervisor dashboard features.
Verify all supervisor features are accessible and working.
Login as Admin and access user management and system settings.
Confirm Admin features are available and function correctly.

title: Barcode Scanner Reads Supported Formats
description: Validate that the native barcode scanner accurately reads multiple international barcode formats: EAN-13, UPC-A, Code 128, and QR Code.

steps.description: Open staff scan interface.
Scan sample EAN-13 barcode.
Verify barcode is recognized and item record is retrieved.
Scan sample UPC-A barcode.
Item data matches scanned barcode.
Scan sample Code 128 barcode.
Item retrieval is successful.
Scan sample QR code containing valid product info.
Correct product information is displayed for verification.

title: Barcode Scanner Fallback to Manual Entry
description: Test that manual barcode entry is supported and functioning correctly when barcode scanning hardware or camera access is unavailable or fails.

steps.description: Open staff scanning interface with camera permission denied.
Verify manual barcode entry input field is displayed.
Manually enter a valid barcode number and submit.
Verify item is fetched and displayed correctly.
Enter invalid barcode number and submit.
Error message displayed indicating barcode not found.

title: Create Stock Verification Session
description: Verify Staff user can create a new stock verification session with selected warehouse and required initial details.

steps.description: Login as Staff user.
Navigate to session creation interface.
Select warehouse and enter mandatory fields for new session.
Submit to create new verification session.
Verify session is created with 'In Progress' status and visible in session list.

title: Add and Update Count Lines with Quantity and Serial Numbers
description: Verify staff can scan or input items to add count lines with quantities and serial numbers; updates reflect in session with discrepancy detection.

steps.description: Open active stock verification session.
Scan barcode for an existing item.
Input quantity and optional serial numbers for scan.
Count line added or updated with correct quantity and serial info.
Discrepancy against ERPNext data is flagged immediately.
Manually modify count quantity for existing count line.
Change persists and discrepancy is recalculated.

title: Discrepancy Detection and Flagging During Counting
description: Verify discrepancies between counted quantities and ERPNext item data are detected in real-time and flagged with visible indicators.

steps.description: Scan an item barcode with quantity differing from ERPNext data.
UI highlights the count line as discrepant.
Scan an item matching ERPNext quantity.
No discrepancy flags are raised.

title: Supervisor Approves Stock Verification Session
description: Verify Supervisor can access session details, review discrepancies, and approve or reject count lines with audit logging.

steps.description: Login as Supervisor.
Navigate to supervisor dashboard and open pending session.
Review count lines with discrepancies.
Approve or reject individual count lines or entire session.
Session status updates accordingly and audit log records actions.
Notifications are sent to relevant users.

title: ERPNext Data Synchronization with Conflict Detection
description: Verify that ERPNext item data sync successfully pulls data without loss, detects conflicts, and allows interactive conflict resolution.

steps.description: Initiate ERPNext sync from system.
ERPNext items data is updated in the system.
Cause a conflict by modifying same item data in ERPNext and local system.
Run sync process again.
Conflict detected and conflict resolution UI is presented.
Supervisor resolves conflict using resolution UI.
Conflict resolution is saved and reflected in system data.

title: Dynamic Report Generation with Filtering and Export
description: Verify that reports can be generated dynamically with configurable fields, filtered, sorted, and exported in Excel and CSV formats.

steps.description: Login as Supervisor.
Navigate to reports interface.
Configure report fields and apply filters/sorting options.
Generate report preview.
Report data complies with selected fields and filters.
Export report as Excel file.
Excel file downloads successfully and opens with correct data.
Export report as CSV file.
CSV file downloads and content is valid.

title: Offline Queue Operation and Synchronization Upon Reconnection
description: Verify that operations performed offline are queued locally and automatically synchronized to backend upon network restoration without data loss or conflicts.

steps.description: Turn off network connectivity on device.
Create a new stock verification session and add count lines.
Operations are queued locally and visible in offline queue interface.
Restore network connectivity.
Queued operations synchronize automatically with backend.
No data conflicts or duplicates occur during sync.

title: Supervisor Dashboard Analytics and Export Scheduling
description: Verify that supervisor dashboard displays real-time analytics, supports export scheduling, and allows managing export jobs.

steps.description: Login as Supervisor and open dashboard.
Verify analytics visualizations load correctly.
Schedule a report export job for a future time.
Export job is listed and status can be monitored.
Cancel scheduled export job.
Job is removed/cancelled successfully.

title: Admin User Management and System Configuration
description: Verify that Admin users can create, edit, and delete users, assign roles, configure system settings, and control system services from the control panel.

steps.description: Login as Admin user.
Access user management interface.
Create a new user and assign Staff role.
New user appears in user list with correct role.
Edit user details and roles.
Changes persist and are reflected.
Delete a user.
User is removed successfully.
Access system configuration settings and modify parameters.
Configurations update and apply correctly.
Perform start, stop, and restart of backend services.
Service control commands execute and system status updates accordingly.

title: Activity and Error Logs Capture and Filter
description: Verify the system captures user activity and error logs comprehensively, supports searching, filtering and audit trail compliance.

steps.description: Generate user activities by performing typical user operations.
Cause system error by inputting invalid data or network failure.
Login as Admin and access logs interface.
Search and filter logs by user, date range, error severity.
Activity and error logs are displayed matching filter criteria.
Audit trails show detailed information on operations performed.

title: Mobile UI Responsiveness and Dark Mode Toggle
description: Verify that UI components respond properly to different screen sizes and orientations and dark mode toggle switches themes correctly.

steps.description: Open app on mobile device in portrait orientation.
Layouts render correctly without overlapping or clipping.
Rotate device to landscape orientation.
UI adjusts appropriately to new layout.
Toggle dark mode on and off from settings.
Theme colors switch smoothly and UI elements remain accessible and visually consistent.

title: Security Compliance with OWASP Standards
description: Verify security measures including secure token storage, input validation, rate limiting, and secure HTTP headers to comply with OWASP best practices.

steps.description: Inspect JWT storage; confirm tokens are stored securely and not in localStorage.
Attempt SQL injection or XSS by submitting malicious input in forms.
Input is sanitized and no injection or XSS occurs.
Send rapid consecutive authentication requests to test rate limiting.
Rate limiting triggers and blocks excessive requests.
Verify HTTP response headers include security controls such as Content-Security-Policy and X-Content-Type-Options.
Secure headers are present and correctly configured.

title: Performance Load Metrics and Optimization
description: Test that application meets performance benchmarks for load times and responsiveness, including effects of power saving mode and caching.

steps.description: Measure cold start time of app on typical mobile device.
App loads within acceptable time thresholds (<3 seconds).
Navigate through major UI areas including scanning, session management, and reports.
Navigation and data loading responses are smooth without delays.
Enable power saving mode in app settings.
App performance remains acceptable and power usage is reduced.
Verify caching reduces data fetch times on repeated requests.

title: Notifications and Toast Message Feedback
description: Verify that users receive appropriate toast notifications for key actions, errors, and recovery options with consistent formatting.

steps.description: Perform successful operation such as creating a new session.
Success toast notification is shown briefly with clear message.
Trigger an error such as invalid barcode entry.
Error toast notification appears with retry or help options.
Perform an operation offline causing queuing.
Informative notification indicates offline status and sync progress.
